p: In a time of major social, climatic and environmental changes, several old concepts are back in fashion: “health is one” (one health approach), “the microbe is nothing, the context is everything” (Antoine Béchamp, Louis Pasteur), “diseases will always continue to emerge” [ 1]. All these old, but still very relevant views require a holistic approach, taking into account the complexity of interactions between diseases, microbes, hosts, vectors, environment, and their evolution as described by Mirko Grmek [ 2], under the term pathocenosis. Emergence of SARS-Cov2 viruses (Covid-19 disease) in 2019, dramatically confirms these predictions.
